metadata.Description: Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.
The use of clean and efficient cookstoves and fuels to reduce indoor air pollution and improve health, environment, and livelihoods.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies implement the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies provide funding for research in renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies focus on developing clean cooking solutions to reduce indoor air pollution and improve health.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies are included in the Energy Access Program to provide affordable and reliable energy to underserved communities.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies collaborate and partner with local communities to ensure their energy needs are met sustainably.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies contribute to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies monitor energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and energy-saving measures.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies target energy poverty by providing affordable and accessible energy solutions to marginalized communities.
relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies

relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies address environmental sustainability by promoting the use of clean and renewable energy sources.

energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: clean cooking
relations.Description: Clean cooking implements energy efficiency policies that promote the use of clean and efficient cooking technologies.

relations.Subject: clean cooking
relations.Description: Clean cooking funds renewable energy projects that aim to provide clean cooking solutions to communities.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

Fossil fuels are a sub-component of traditional energy technologies. They include coal, oil, and natural gas, which are formed from the remains of ancient plants and animals. Fossil fuels are widely used for electricity generation, heating, and transportation.
relations.Subject: fossil fuels

relations.Description: Biomass energy is a type of traditional energy technology that involves using organic materials, such as wood, agricultural residues, and dedicated energy crops, to generate heat and electricity. Biomass energy is considered renewable as the organic materials can be replenished.
relations.Subject: biomass energy

relations.Description: Hydropower is a sub-component of traditional energy technologies. It involves harnessing the energy of flowing or falling water to generate electricity. Hydropower plants can range from small-scale run-of-river systems to large-scale dams.
relations.Subject: hydropower

relations.Description: Solar energy is a sub-component of traditional energy technologies. It involves capturing the energy from sunlight and converting it into electricity or heat. Solar energy technologies include photovoltaic panels and solar thermal systems.
relations.Subject: solar energy

relations.Description: Wind energy is a sub-component of traditional energy technologies. It involves harnessing the power of wind to generate electricity. Wind turbines are used to convert the kinetic energy of the wind into electrical energy.
relations.Subject: wind energy
